bush to eu : we 're working on closing guantanamo -pipe- europe -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 21.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 21.09.2010 home news germany europe map world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de europe -pipe- 21.06.2006 bush to eu : we 're working on closing guantanamo großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : bush said he himself would like guantanamo to be over with us president george w. bush and eu leaders wednesday sent a warning to iran and north korea on their nuclear plans but avoided a public squabble over eu concerns at human rights abuses in guantanamo bay prison camp . at a summit designed to herald deepening transatlantic ties after several years of discord over the us-led iraq war - opposed by france , germany and other eu states - bush and austrian chancellor wolfgang schüssel went out of their way to focus on areas of agreement rather than discord .
austria is current president of the 25-nation eu .
bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : bush and austrian chancellor wolfgang schüssel " when we work together we can accomplish big things ... the world needs us to work together , " bush told reporters at a joint news conference with schüssel .
bush said he fully understood differences with the eu over iraq . " what is past is past , " he added .
us still worki n g o n solutio n for priso n ers seeking to defuse rising eu anger at the guantanamo bay detention centers following the recent suicide of three detainees , the us president said he shared european concerns but had no immediate solution to the problem .
" i would like it to be over with , " he said .
" we will send people back to their home countries . "
bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : some detainees , such as britain 's " tipton three " , have been sent home already an estimated 400 detainees are left in guantanamo - mainly from saudi arabia , afghanistan and yemen - and 200 have been sent back , he said , adding that some of those in guantanamo needed to be tried because they were " cold blooded murderers " who will " murder someone if out on the street . " bush added that he was waiting " for the us supreme court to determine " how they would be tried . complyi n g with huma n rights a joint eu-us statement meanwhile did not include a specific reference to eu calls for the closure of guantanamo bay but the us vowed to ensure that measures taken to combat terrorism complied fully with human rights law .
bildunterschrift : complying with human rights law ?
guantanamo prison camp " consistent with our common values we will ensure that measures taken to combat terrorism comply fully with our international obligations , including human rights law , refugee law and international humanitarian law , " the statement stressed .
" we attach great importance to our ongoing in-depth dialogue on our common fight against terrorism and our respective domestic and legal obligations . "
eu diplomats said the text represented " a good success " for europeans but admitted the language was not as specific or as strong as the 25-nation bloc would have liked .
war n i n g ira n ... bush and the eu also sent a strong joint warning to iran to take the " positive path " by re-engaging in nuclear talks with the international community .
bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : iran 's mahmoud ahmadinejad the us president said iran 's leaders had " weeks , not months " to respond to a new european incentives package aimed at persuading tehran to suspend uranium enrichment .
asked if he accepted iranian president mahmoud ahmadinejad 's decision to reply to the european offer by mid-august , bush told reporters : " it seems like a lot of time for an answer . "
the us , the eu , russia and china were united in telling iran " you get to choose , " said bush , referring to earlier us and european statements that tehran had a choice between accepting further talks or being hauled in front of the united nations security council for possible sanctions . ... a n d north korea bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a north korean anti-us poster the eu and the us also warned north korea against testing long- range missiles , saying pyongyang should return to six-party talks meant to coax the reclusive country to abandon its nuclear weapons project .
" we expect north koreans to keep their agreements , " bush said .
" it makes people nervous when non-transparent regimes announce they have nuclear warheads . "
the six-party process involves north and south korea , japan , china , the united states and russia .
the talks have been stalled since november .
defe n di n g us i n europe bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : leftist protesters in vienna on wednesday asked by reporters why he thought the us had a bad image in europe - where public polls continue to show deep wariness of us foreign policy - bush said he did not intend to bow to such pressure .
" it is absurd for people to think we are more dangerous than iran , " the us president said , adding that while the sept.11 , 2001 terrorist attacks on the us were a " moment " for the eu , they marked " a change in our way of thinking . "
he said he was doing his best to explain that us foreign policy was " tough but compassionate . " dw staff / dpa -lrb- win -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de us expected to pledge to respect human rights at summit us president george w. bush meets with the 25-nation european union wednesday in a summit expected to show that the two sides closing ranks over respecting human rights while fighting terrorism .
-lrb- june 21 , 2006 -rrb- eu parliamentarians call for tribunal to replace guantanamo eu parliamentarians are stepping up the pressure on european governments to get the united states to shut down its controversial prison at guantanamo bay and set up an international tribunal in its place .
-lrb- june 15 , 2006 -rrb- iran open to nuclear talks but will not discuss technology iran 's controversial president mahmoud ahmadinejad said he was willing to get back to the negotiating table regarding his country 's disputed nuclear program .
but he warned the west of trying to dictate too much .
-lrb- june 8 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic dw-tv reports from the eu-us summit in vienna feedback do you believe bush that he wants guantanamo to be over with ?
please include your name and country in your reply .

dw-tv europe live im focus we 're sorry , due to legal issues this content can not be transmitted as live stream .
if you are inside the united states , it is still possible for you to enjoy dw-tv .
for more information , please click here .
dw-radio live music this week international peace day - september 21 listen live people natascha kampusch , the austrian who was kept prisoner from age 10 to 18 , publishes her autobigraphy .
listen to the report postcards from europe an insider look at the continent .
postcard from europe : technology overtakes prague 's taxi drivers uk prepares for the pope it simply is n't cricket are the gay games necessary ?
love parade - the end of an era europe keep up with the latest in europe .
macedonia 's drug city belarus : the last dictatorship islamic world intercultural dialogue analysis , background and commentary on issues tied to dialogue with the islamic world . © dw 2010 deutsche welle is not responsible for the content of external websites .

guantanamo prison camp " consistent with our common values we will ensure that measures taken to combat terrorism comply fully with our international obligations , including human rights law , refugee law and international humanitarian law , " the statement stressed .

the us , the eu , russia and china were united in telling iran " you get to choose , " said bush , referring to earlier us and european statements that tehran had a choice between accepting further talks or being hauled in front of the united nations security council for possible sanctions . ... a n d north korea bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a north korean anti-us poster the eu and the us also warned north korea against testing long- range missiles , saying pyongyang should return to six-party talks meant to coax the reclusive country to abandon its nuclear weapons project .

" it makes people nervous when non-transparent regimes announce they have nuclear warheads . "

the talks have been stalled since november .

he said he was doing his best to explain that us foreign policy was " tough but compassionate . " dw staff / dpa -lrb- win -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de us expected to pledge to respect human rights at summit us president george w. bush meets with the 25-nation european union wednesday in a summit expected to show that the two sides closing ranks over respecting human rights while fighting terrorism .
-lrb- june 21 , 2006 -rrb- eu parliamentarians call for tribunal to replace guantanamo eu parliamentarians are stepping up the pressure on european governments to get the united states to shut down its controversial prison at guantanamo bay and set up an international tribunal in its place .
-lrb- june 15 , 2006 -rrb- iran open to nuclear talks but will not discuss technology iran 's controversial president mahmoud ahmadinejad said he was willing to get back to the negotiating table regarding his country 's disputed nuclear program .
but he warned the west of trying to dictate too much .
-lrb- june 8 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic dw-tv reports from the eu-us summit in vienna 9798 radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .

bush to eu : we 're working on closing guantanamo -pipe- europe -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 21.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 18.12.2010 home news germany europe map world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de europe -pipe- 21.06.2006 bush to eu : we 're working on closing guantanamo großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : bush said he himself would like guantanamo to be over with us president george w. bush and eu leaders wednesday sent a warning to iran and north korea on their nuclear plans but avoided a public squabble over eu concerns at human rights abuses in guantanamo bay prison camp . at a summit designed to herald deepening transatlantic ties after several years of discord over the us-led iraq war - opposed by france , germany and other eu states - bush and austrian chancellor wolfgang schüssel went out of their way to focus on areas of agreement rather than discord .
austria is current president of the 25-nation eu .
bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : bush and austrian chancellor wolfgang schüssel " when we work together we can accomplish big things ... the world needs us to work together , " bush told reporters at a joint news conference with schüssel .
bush said he fully understood differences with the eu over iraq . " what is past is past , " he added .
us still worki n g o n solutio n for priso n ers seeking to defuse rising eu anger at the guantanamo bay detention centers following the recent suicide of three detainees , the us president said he shared european concerns but had no immediate solution to the problem .
" i would like it to be over with , " he said .
" we will send people back to their home countries . "
bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : some detainees , such as britain 's " tipton three " , have been sent home already an estimated 400 detainees are left in guantanamo - mainly from saudi arabia , afghanistan and yemen - and 200 have been sent back , he said , adding that some of those in guantanamo needed to be tried because they were " cold blooded murderers " who will " murder someone if out on the street . " bush added that he was waiting " for the us supreme court to determine " how they would be tried . complyi n g with huma n rights a joint eu-us statement meanwhile did not include a specific reference to eu calls for the closure of guantanamo bay but the us vowed to ensure that measures taken to combat terrorism complied fully with human rights law .
bildunterschrift : complying with human rights law ?
guantanamo prison camp " consistent with our common values we will ensure that measures taken to combat terrorism comply fully with our international obligations , including human rights law , refugee law and international humanitarian law , " the statement stressed .
" we attach great importance to our ongoing in-depth dialogue on our common fight against terrorism and our respective domestic and legal obligations . "
eu diplomats said the text represented " a good success " for europeans but admitted the language was not as specific or as strong as the 25-nation bloc would have liked .
war n i n g ira n ... bush and the eu also sent a strong joint warning to iran to take the " positive path " by re-engaging in nuclear talks with the international community .
bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : iran 's mahmoud ahmadinejad the us president said iran 's leaders had " weeks , not months " to respond to a new european incentives package aimed at persuading tehran to suspend uranium enrichment .
asked if he accepted iranian president mahmoud ahmadinejad 's decision to reply to the european offer by mid-august , bush told reporters : " it seems like a lot of time for an answer . "
the us , the eu , russia and china were united in telling iran " you get to choose , " said bush , referring to earlier us and european statements that tehran had a choice between accepting further talks or being hauled in front of the united nations security council for possible sanctions . ... a n d north korea bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a north korean anti-us poster the eu and the us also warned north korea against testing long- range missiles , saying pyongyang should return to six-party talks meant to coax the reclusive country to abandon its nuclear weapons project .
" we expect north koreans to keep their agreements , " bush said .
" it makes people nervous when non-transparent regimes announce they have nuclear warheads . "
the six-party process involves north and south korea , japan , china , the united states and russia .
the talks have been stalled since november .
defe n di n g us i n europe bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : leftist protesters in vienna on wednesday asked by reporters why he thought the us had a bad image in europe - where public polls continue to show deep wariness of us foreign policy - bush said he did not intend to bow to such pressure .
" it is absurd for people to think we are more dangerous than iran , " the us president said , adding that while the sept.11 , 2001 terrorist attacks on the us were a " moment " for the eu , they marked " a change in our way of thinking . "
he said he was doing his best to explain that us foreign policy was " tough but compassionate . " dw staff / dpa -lrb- win -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de us expected to pledge to respect human rights at summit us president george w. bush meets with the 25-nation european union wednesday in a summit expected to show that the two sides closing ranks over respecting human rights while fighting terrorism .
-lrb- june 21 , 2006 -rrb- eu parliamentarians call for tribunal to replace guantanamo eu parliamentarians are stepping up the pressure on european governments to get the united states to shut down its controversial prison at guantanamo bay and set up an international tribunal in its place .
-lrb- june 15 , 2006 -rrb- iran open to nuclear talks but will not discuss technology iran 's controversial president mahmoud ahmadinejad said he was willing to get back to the negotiating table regarding his country 's disputed nuclear program .
but he warned the west of trying to dictate too much .
-lrb- june 8 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic dw-tv reports from the eu-us summit in vienna feedback do you believe bush that he wants guantanamo to be over with ?
please include your name and country in your reply .

guantanamo prison camp " consistent with our common values we will ensure that measures taken to combat terrorism comply fully with our international obligations , including human rights law , refugee law and international humanitarian law , " the statement stressed .

" it makes people nervous when non-transparent regimes announce they have nuclear warheads . "

the talks have been stalled since november .

he said he was doing his best to explain that us foreign policy was " tough but compassionate . mexico go on the attack from the start .
portugal are missing five of their top players including deco , pauletta and ronaldo 2. min .
mexico have a great chance to score but the portuguese keeper manages to keep the ball out .
4. min .
portugal have their first foray forward but mexico clear and send the ball downfield .
6. min .
goal ! ! ! !
maniche 's scores for portugal ..
6. min .
beautiful goal for portugal .
simao made a darting run on the left side and crossed the ball in the back of the mexican defense to set up maniche who slotted home from inside the box .
no chance for sanchez in the mexican goal .
8. min .
portugal are on top now .
mexico shocked by the early goal .
they need at least a draw to be sure of qualifying for the next round .
10. min .
portugal are passing the ball around in defense waiting for their opportunity to go forward .
mexico are clearly stunned .
12. min .
portugal play a ball into the box after some neat passing play around the area but mexico clear the danger .
13. min .
a tactical game at the moment with both sides giving each other lots of space to pass the ball 15. min .
fifteen minutes gone and the fast and furious start has tailed off somewhat .
portugal happy with their lead and mexico trying to get back in the game .
17. min .
mexico float a ball into the box but it 's easily cleared .
18. min .
mexico are going nowhere .
long balls from the back are easily tackled by the solid portuguese defense .
20. min .
figo gains a corner and takes it himself .
the ball comes back to the midfielder who darts into the box but his cross is caught by sanchez .
21. min .
yellow for francisco rodriguez maniche makes a run deep into the mexican half and is brought down on the edge of the box by rodriguez .
23. min .
the free kick is driven straight into the wall and goes out for corner for portugal .
23. min .
penalty for portugal penalty for a handball in the box by marquez 24. min .
goal for portugal simao scores from the penalty spot with a powerful and well placed strike .
25. min .
portugal are cruising now .
two goals up after 25 minutes with five top players out and mexico now have to have an eye on the game between iran and angola .
27. min .
portugal almost go three up .
postiga heads towards goal and his shot is saved and bounces into the path of tiago but he ca n't get over the ball and it flies over the bar .
29. min .
ricardo makes a great save for portugal after bravo latches on the end of a cross .
portugal lucky not to have conceded a goal .
30. min .
goal for mexico fonseca jumps unchallenged in the box and heads home for mexico from a corner .
what a game now ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! 32. min .
the game is really open now .
portugal were cruising but mexico kept battling and are now on the attack again but it comes to nothing .
34. min .
miguel dances into the box and almost gets past his man but it 's cleared for a corner and mexico head out and play the ball downfield .
37. min .
the game has dropped in pace slightly after the past few minutes of end to end action .
38. min .
free-kick from simao low and hard into the box but mexico 's salcido clears for a corner .
39. min .
fonseca is free in the box and heads towards goal but he 's ruled offside .
40. min .
mexico need another goal to book their place in the next round .
and at the moment it could go either way with both teams playing flowing , attacking football .
41. min .
miguel drives into the mexican half and plays a lovely crossfield pass to figo .
the captain supplies tiago who blasts towards goal but hits a mexican defender .
43. min .
maniche tries a long-range shot from 35 meters but no problem for sanchez .
44. min .
wonderful strike from pardo from outside the box draws great save from ricardo .
45. min .
mexico almost grab the equalizer as fonseca tries to get on the end of a cross but clatters into ricardo who needs treatment .
45 + 1. min .
portugal are riding their luck at the moment and are fortunate to still be ahead .
ricardo is back on his feet for portugal .
45 + 1. min .
one minute of stoppage time to be played .
45 + 2. min .
half time half time in gelsenkirchen after a highly entertaining and exhilarating 45 minutes .
portugal deservedly took the lead through maniche and doubled it with simao 's penalty .
mexico took a long time to recover from the shock but clawed a goal back through fonseca and were unlucky not to have equalized before the break .
we can look forward to an entertaining second half as mexico go in search of that all important goal .
46. min .
second half kicks off 47. min .
mexico start the second knowing they need a goal to be safe .
49. min .
mexico are pushing forward looking for a goal but portugal remain solid at the back and clear the danger .
50. min .
fonseca almost through on the edge of the box but could n't control the ball .
51. min .
fonseca is everywhere at the moment and gains a free kick for mexico 40 meters out 52. min .
petit fires the ball in and it whizzes just past the post for a portugal goal kick .
53. min .
portugal have control of the ball now and attempt their first real attack of the second half .
but mexico are defending well .
55. min .
fonseca has a shot on goal from the edge of the box after a lovely lay-off from bravo but it is easily saved by ricardo .
57. min .
penalty for mexico penalty for mexico after perez is brought down in the box 58. min .
penalty missed bravo 's penalty goes high and wide and portugal count themselves lucky .
60. min .
mexico have gotten over the missed penalty and are pushing forward for the equalizer .
60. min .
perez sent off ! !
perez is sent off for diving in the box after the whole stadium thought mexico had been awarded another penalty .
mexico are down to ten men and have an uphill battle now .
63. min .
mexico are still in control of the game and bravo misses a golden opportunity with only the keeper to beat as mexico break the offside trap .
65. min .
mexico deserve to be on level terms now but they have simply not taken their chances .
66. min .
tiago has a shot on goal from outside the box but his shot goes left and wide . 68. min .
angola have taken the lead against iran and mexico are now level on points with the africans but just ahead on goal difference 70. min .
substitutio n nuno gomes comes on for postiga 71. min .
substitio n castro comes on for pineda for mexico 72. min .
substitute gomes almost scores for portugal but blasts the ball over the bar from five meters out .
74. min .
mexico are still pushing forward knowing that angola are leading and breathing down their necks .
75. min .
mendez wins a corner for mexico but the ball is cleared .
ten men mexico definitely have the upper hand but ca n't manage to score and risk leaving themselves open at the back .
77. min .
portugal are really taking their time on free kicks much to the dislike of the mexican fans in the stadium .
79. min .
mexico are throwing everything forward now but with a man down they are finding the going tough against a strong portuguese defense .
80. min .
portugal substitution figo is substituted for luis boa morte 82. min .
iran have equalized against angola which means that mexico can breathe easy again .
as things stand they are through behind portugal .
83. min .
marquez crashes into his own goalkeeper as he clears a square ball across the box .
sanchez needs treatment but is back on his feet .
85. min .
mexico are starting to look tired safe in the knowledge that they are probably through to the next round .
86. min .
portugal are passing the ball around in defense playing down the remaining minutes but mexico are still fighting for the equalizer 88. min .
boa morte yellow card boa morte is carded by the referee 89. min .
mexico free kick flashes across goal but no-one there to put it in .
90. min .
as the game enters stoppage time mexico continue to attack in search of the goal they deserve after fine play in the second half .
90 + 2. min .
3 minutes of stoppage time added .
90 + 3. min .
full time in gelsenkirchen portugal hang on for a narrow victory portugal manage to hang on against a brave ten man mexico , which missed a penalty and a number of other fantastic opportunities to score and are made to pay for those squandered chances .
but despite the loss the mexicans are though to the next round along with group winners portugal . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .

bonn 's blue samurai -pipe- features -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 21.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 13.12.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de features -pipe- 21.06.2006 bonn 's blue samurai großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : enthusiasm for their team - and for exploring germany japan 's national soccer team - and many of their countrymen and women - is staying in bonn this month during the world cup .
dw-world.de talked to both germany 's guests from the land of the rising sun and their hosts . a stroll through the streets of bonn will reveal that many japanese visitors have traveled half way around the world to support their national soccer stars as they face the world 's very best this month in the world cup .
they have chosen to stay in the former german capital for part or all of the month of june because the japanese team also has set up its headquarters here . while all of germany was busy preparing for scores of international guests , bonn focused especially on preparation for the japanese guests to come . g-jamps the team 's official media and fan headquarters - dubbed g-jamps -lrb- germany japan national team media partners supporters -rrb- - is not located in a hotel , stadium or office building , but in a museum . " we chose -lrb- the rheinisches landesmuseum -rrb- as our media and fan center because many of the guests from japan who are coming to bonn during the world cup also want to take a bit of culture back with them , " said masato watanabe , a representative of the japanese football association . g-jamps serves as a central meeting point not only for japanese visitors and journalists but also for anybody interested in the japanese team .
but soccer is just the beginning .
courses , performances and presentations are being offered throughout the world cup in cooperation with the german-japanese society - everything from flower arranging and kimonos to martial arts , go -lrb- a japanese board game -rrb- and origami is on the program . the museum 's restaurant features both japanese and local cuisine and , in the spirit of intercultural understanding , sushi is only on offer when the german team plays . sausage a n d beer bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : fans were waiting with pens and hopeful smiles when the team left their hotel to go to practice a japanese beer-maker is an official sponsor of the country 's team and its presence ca n't be overlooked at g-jamps .
but visitors from japan are eager to take advantage of the opportunity to get to know elements of german culture while they are in the country .
it is not surprising that beer and sausage are among the musts . " most of the japanese guests speak good english and those who do n't bring pictures with them of german dishes they would like to try , " said paul hofmann , a server at haus daufenbach .
through connections with the united nations , located in bonn , the combined restaurant and hotel also has numerous guests from other un nations , including yemen , ecuador , and ethiopia . michael thomas from zum gequetschen -lrb- which could be roughly translated as " at the squeezed " -rrb- , a popular restaurant in the city center featuring traditional german cuisine , said that around 50 percent of international guests this month are from japan . " the japanese customers drink less and meals are more communal , " he said .
" they 'll order one dish and four plates and share it . " home comfort bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : both sushi and sausage are availabe here at the blue samurai 's media and fan headquarters but heavy german dishes on a daily basis get to be too much after a while .
according to a server at a bonn sushi bar , some of the japanese visitors also search out more familiar tastes in between the sauerkraut and bratwurst . " the japanese noodle house around the corner has many japanese guests , " she said .
" they prefer warm dishes and sushi is more of a snack .
they come here first to eat sushi and then they go over to the noodle house for miso soup , tempura and other warm things . " big stadium or big scree n bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the rising sun is visible all day long in bonn to welcome the team and their fans well nourished , rested and ready to go , blue samurai fans have several options when it comes to watching their team in action .
the best bet is to visit the stadium in bonn , where the team trains .
times are made public and entry is free - quite a deal , considering the hundreds of euros people pay to see the same team in a live game .
the only disadvantage , of course , is the absence of an opponent . those who want to see the games but do n't have tickets can still enjoy the stadium atmosphere by going to the big screen set up on one of bonn 's two large , open market squares .
there the cheapest seat goes for 11 euros -lrb- 13.50 dollars -rrb- , which makes the slightly smaller screen at the pub around the corner look a bit more appealing . megunu and musaku , two soccer fans from japan , were on their way to view the blue samurai during a training session at bonn 's stadium .
they had met as tourists in barcelona and decided to continue on together to germany for the world cup .
when asked about the blue samurai 's performance , musaku did n't beat around the bush . " the players are very good , but the coach is bad , " he said . o n e poi n t for japa n japan 's national coach , zico , is a soccer legend from brazil . " in my opinion it 's better to face brazil in this round rather than later in the k.o. round , " zico was quoted as saying in die zeit .
" better now and then again the finals .
whoever wants to achieve something at the world cup has to be prepared for everything . " after losing to australia last week 3-1 and tying with croatia 0-0 on sunday , the blue samurai will come up against zico 's native brazil on thursday , june 22 at 7 p.m.
utc . kate bowen send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de a tale of two cities - tokyo and berlin an art exhibition showcases more than a century of german-japanese artistic exchange opened last week at berlin 's national gallery .
it features everything from dada and mavo to giant polka dots and sleeping containers .
-lrb- june 15 , 2006 -rrb- japan survive croatia challenge but chances of progress slim japan and croatia battled to a goalless draw in nurenberg on sunday which left both nations with a slim chance of reaching the second round of the world cup .
-lrb- june 18 , 2006 -rrb- japan coach zico drafts in ogasawara for crucial croatia clash japan coach zico is looking to kashima antlers skipper mitsuo ogasawara to bolster his flagging attack in the make-or-break world cup match against croatia on sunday .
-lrb- june 18 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic world cup reporter : turning japanese feedback we want to hear from you !
send us an e-mail if you would like to respond to any article .
please include your name and country .

bonn 's blue samurai -pipe- features -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 21.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 25.09.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de features -pipe- 21.06.2006 bonn 's blue samurai großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : enthusiasm for their team - and for exploring germany japan 's national soccer team - and many of their countrymen and women - is staying in bonn this month during the world cup .
dw-world.de talked to both germany 's guests from the land of the rising sun and their hosts . a stroll through the streets of bonn will reveal that many japanese visitors have traveled half way around the world to support their national soccer stars as they face the world 's very best this month in the world cup .
they have chosen to stay in the former german capital for part or all of the month of june because the japanese team also has set up its headquarters here . while all of germany was busy preparing for scores of international guests , bonn focused especially on preparation for the japanese guests to come . g-jamps the team 's official media and fan headquarters - dubbed g-jamps -lrb- germany japan national team media partners supporters -rrb- - is not located in a hotel , stadium or office building , but in a museum . " we chose -lrb- the rheinisches landesmuseum -rrb- as our media and fan center because many of the guests from japan who are coming to bonn during the world cup also want to take a bit of culture back with them , " said masato watanabe , a representative of the japanese football association . g-jamps serves as a central meeting point not only for japanese visitors and journalists but also for anybody interested in the japanese team .
but soccer is just the beginning .
courses , performances and presentations are being offered throughout the world cup in cooperation with the german-japanese society - everything from flower arranging and kimonos to martial arts , go -lrb- a japanese board game -rrb- and origami is on the program . the museum 's restaurant features both japanese and local cuisine and , in the spirit of intercultural understanding , sushi is only on offer when the german team plays . sausage a n d beer bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : fans were waiting with pens and hopeful smiles when the team left their hotel to go to practice a japanese beer-maker is an official sponsor of the country 's team and its presence ca n't be overlooked at g-jamps .
but visitors from japan are eager to take advantage of the opportunity to get to know elements of german culture while they are in the country .
it is not surprising that beer and sausage are among the musts . " most of the japanese guests speak good english and those who do n't bring pictures with them of german dishes they would like to try , " said paul hofmann , a server at haus daufenbach .
through connections with the united nations , located in bonn , the combined restaurant and hotel also has numerous guests from other un nations , including yemen , ecuador , and ethiopia . michael thomas from zum gequetschen -lrb- which could be roughly translated as " at the squeezed " -rrb- , a popular restaurant in the city center featuring traditional german cuisine , said that around 50 percent of international guests this month are from japan . " the japanese customers drink less and meals are more communal , " he said .
" they 'll order one dish and four plates and share it . " home comfort bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : both sushi and sausage are availabe here at the blue samurai 's media and fan headquarters but heavy german dishes on a daily basis get to be too much after a while .
according to a server at a bonn sushi bar , some of the japanese visitors also search out more familiar tastes in between the sauerkraut and bratwurst . " the japanese noodle house around the corner has many japanese guests , " she said .
" they prefer warm dishes and sushi is more of a snack .
they come here first to eat sushi and then they go over to the noodle house for miso soup , tempura and other warm things . " big stadium or big scree n bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the rising sun is visible all day long in bonn to welcome the team and their fans well nourished , rested and ready to go , blue samurai fans have several options when it comes to watching their team in action .
the best bet is to visit the stadium in bonn , where the team trains .
times are made public and entry is free - quite a deal , considering the hundreds of euros people pay to see the same team in a live game .
the only disadvantage , of course , is the absence of an opponent . those who want to see the games but do n't have tickets can still enjoy the stadium atmosphere by going to the big screen set up on one of bonn 's two large , open market squares .
there the cheapest seat goes for 11 euros -lrb- 13.50 dollars -rrb- , which makes the slightly smaller screen at the pub around the corner look a bit more appealing . megunu and musaku , two soccer fans from japan , were on their way to view the blue samurai during a training session at bonn 's stadium .
they had met as tourists in barcelona and decided to continue on together to germany for the world cup .
when asked about the blue samurai 's performance , musaku did n't beat around the bush . " the players are very good , but the coach is bad , " he said . o n e poi n t for japa n japan 's national coach , zico , is a soccer legend from brazil . " in my opinion it 's better to face brazil in this round rather than later in the k.o. round , " zico was quoted as saying in die zeit .
" better now and then again the finals .
whoever wants to achieve something at the world cup has to be prepared for everything . " after losing to australia last week 3-1 and tying with croatia 0-0 on sunday , the blue samurai will come up against zico 's native brazil on thursday , june 22 at 7 p.m.
utc . kate bowen send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de a tale of two cities - tokyo and berlin an art exhibition showcases more than a century of german-japanese artistic exchange opened last week at berlin 's national gallery .
it features everything from dada and mavo to giant polka dots and sleeping containers .
-lrb- june 15 , 2006 -rrb- japan survive croatia challenge but chances of progress slim japan and croatia battled to a goalless draw in nurenberg on sunday which left both nations with a slim chance of reaching the second round of the world cup .
-lrb- june 18 , 2006 -rrb- japan coach zico drafts in ogasawara for crucial croatia clash japan coach zico is looking to kashima antlers skipper mitsuo ogasawara to bolster his flagging attack in the make-or-break world cup match against croatia on sunday .
-lrb- june 18 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic world cup reporter : turning japanese feedback we want to hear from you !
send us an e-mail if you would like to respond to any article .
please include your name and country .

stadiums check out the 12 venues for the 2006 world cup .
world cup 2006 stadiums the best of germany germany has much that is worth celebrating .
here dw-world presents 100 reasons to love germany .
germany 's train stations more than soccer participants of a dw-akademie workshop take a closer look at the other side of the world cup .
world cup blog from the fringe have a laugh read about quirky happenings in thigh-slappin ' germany in this dw-world.de dossier .

" the japanese customers drink less and meals are more communal , " he said .
" they 'll order one dish and four plates and share it . " home comfort bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : both sushi and sausage are availabe here at the blue samurai 's media and fan headquarters but heavy german dishes on a daily basis get to be too much after a while .
according to a server at a bonn sushi bar , some of the japanese visitors also search out more familiar tastes in between the sauerkraut and bratwurst . " the japanese noodle house around the corner has many japanese guests , " she said .
" they prefer warm dishes and sushi is more of a snack .
they come here first to eat sushi and then they go over to the noodle house for miso soup , tempura and other warm things . " big stadium or big scree n bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the rising sun is visible all day long in bonn to welcome the team and their fans well nourished , rested and ready to go , blue samurai fans have several options when it comes to watching their team in action .
the best bet is to visit the stadium in bonn , where the team trains .
times are made public and entry is free - quite a deal , considering the hundreds of euros people pay to see the same team in a live game .
the only disadvantage , of course , is the absence of an opponent . those who want to see the games but do n't have tickets can still enjoy the stadium atmosphere by going to the big screen set up on one of bonn 's two large , open market squares .
there the cheapest seat goes for 11 euros -lrb- 13.50 dollars -rrb- , which makes the slightly smaller screen at the pub around the corner look a bit more appealing . megunu and musaku , two soccer fans from japan , were on their way to view the blue samurai during a training session at bonn 's stadium .
they had met as tourists in barcelona and decided to continue on together to germany for the world cup .
when asked about the blue samurai 's performance , musaku did n't beat around the bush . " the players are very good , but the coach is bad , " he said . o n e poi n t for japa n japan 's national coach , zico , is a soccer legend from brazil . " in my opinion it 's better to face brazil in this round rather than later in the k.o. round , " zico was quoted as saying in die zeit .
" better now and then again the finals .
whoever wants to achieve something at the world cup has to be prepared for everything . " after losing to australia last week 3-1 and tying with croatia 0-0 on sunday , the blue samurai will come up against zico 's native brazil on thursday , june 22 at 7 p.m.
utc . kate bowen send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de a tale of two cities - tokyo and berlin an art exhibition showcases more than a century of german-japanese artistic exchange opened last week at berlin 's national gallery .
it features everything from dada and mavo to giant polka dots and sleeping containers .
-lrb- june 15 , 2006 -rrb- japan survive croatia challenge but chances of progress slim japan and croatia battled to a goalless draw in nurenberg on sunday which left both nations with a slim chance of reaching the second round of the world cup .
-lrb- june 18 , 2006 -rrb- japan coach zico drafts in ogasawara for crucial croatia clash japan coach zico is looking to kashima antlers skipper mitsuo ogasawara to bolster his flagging attack in the make-or-break world cup match against croatia on sunday .
-lrb- june 18 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic world cup reporter : turning japanese feedback we want to hear from you !
send us an e-mail if you would like to respond to any article .
please include your name and country .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de europe -pipe- 21.06.2006 us expected to pledge to respect human rights at summit großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : pressure to close the cuban camp is mounting us president george w. bush meets with the 25-nation european union wednesday in a summit expected to show that the two sides closing ranks over respecting human rights while fighting terrorism . bush is set to pledge that the united states will respect human rights in his war on terror , according to the draft of a final statement for the eu-us summit wednesday that arrives on the heels of european complaints over us treatment of prisoners at guantanamo bay . bush was greeted upon arriving in vienna tuesday by austrian chancellor and current european union president wolfgang schuessel , who had earlier in the day said : " we ca n't have an area where law does not apply , " referring to the us camp in cuba , where hundreds of terror suspects have been held without charge . european governments and rights groups have called on the united states to shut down guantanamo for detaining inmates in legal limbo . the draft of the joint statement by bush and european union leaders says : " consistent with our common values , we will ensure that measures taken to combat terrorism comply fully with our international obligations , including human rights law , refugee law and international humanitarian law . " we attach great importance to our ongoing in-depth dialogue and our common fight against terrorism and our respected domestic and international legal obligations , " according to extracts of the text read to afp . papering over differences the text does not specifically mention guantanamo , which the united states insists is needed in the war against terror . but it appears to show that the eu and the united states will be seeking in vienna to paper over their differences , in a movement of reconciliation that has continued since the two sides bickered deeply over the us invasion of iraq in 2003 . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the us and the eu hope to paper over differences at the summit the united states has refused to join in the kyoto protocol to limit greenhouse gases but the draft text , which is still being worked on one diplomat cautioned , says : " we will work more closely to address the serious and long term challenge of climate change , biodiversity loss , and air pollution and will act with resolve and urgency to reduce greenhouse gas emissions . " eu states have also criticized the united states for cia flights that allegedly stop in european countries on their way to delivering prisoners for torture . washington insists however that all cia flights are in accordance with us and other nations ' laws , particularly against torture . a strong relationship us national security advisor stephen hadley told reporters last week in washington that the summit was " an opportunity to reaffirm the strong relationship between the united states and the european union . " bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the us wants more help in iraq the united states and the eu now have a common line on trying to get iran to curb its nuclear ambitions , with washington even ready to join in eu-led talks with the islamic republic if tehran agrees to suspend uranium enrichment . on monday , bush turned up the pressure on iran , warning of " progressively stronger political and economic sanctions " if it refuses to freeze sensitive nuclear activities in return for talks . the united states and its partners - britain , france and germany , as well as russia and china - have made iran 's suspension of nuclear fuel work that could be weapons-related a condition for starting talks . the eu and the united states are world economic leaders and major partners , with $ 1.7 billion -lrb- 1.3 billion euros -rrb- per day in trade . bush hopes european leaders will improve their offer on agricultural trade to help bring about a breakthrough in stalled global trade talks , a white house official said tuesday . dw staff -lrb- jb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de eu parliamentarians call for tribunal to replace guantanamo eu parliamentarians are stepping up the pressure on european governments to get the united states to shut down its controversial prison at guantanamo bay and set up an international tribunal in its place .
-lrb- june 15 , 2006 -rrb- eu , us present united front ahead of vienna summit vienna is gearing up to host the next eu-us summit on wednesday .
while the relationship between the two powers is often described as " complex , " this time , it seems there is consensus on the main issues up for discussion .
-lrb- june 20 , 2006 -rrb- " bremen taliban " release anticipated a turkish man living in bremen is expected to be allowed to return to germany from the us military base in guantanamo bay .
german authorities may have delayed his release by years , according to media reports .
-lrb- march 29 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic bush and eu leaders meet in vienna feedback what do you think of the summit ?
please include your name and country in your reply .

german industry irked by slow pace of reforms -pipe- business -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 21.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 02.04.2011 home news germany europe world asia business 125 years automobile science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de business -pipe- 21.06.2006 german industry irked by slow pace of reforms großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : reforms in germany are moving at a turtle 's pace , experts complain while most of the country is swept up in world cup fever , that 's not the case for german business leaders .
they 've been eyeing up chancellor merkel 's progress on economic reforms and wonder what she 's waiting for . angela merkel may be enjoying the highest popularity ratings of any post-war german chancellor , but she is fast losing favor among the country 's business leaders and economic experts . at a meeting of industry representatives in berlin on tuesday , the president of the bdi industry federation , jürgen thumann , renewed his stinging criticism of merkel 's reform politics and demanded that her grand coalition of conservatives and social democrats pick up the pace . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : merkel is losing favor with the bdi industry association the difficulty she would have in leading this unwieldy coalition of former political opponents was well noted when merkel took office .
but according to thumann , this difficulty is no excuse for political hemming and hawing over much-needed reforms . " we , the bdi and our members are starting to get rather impatient , " he told reporters in berlin on monday .
" impatient because the political debate in germany has hardly yielded any results yet , impatient because of many political decisions we think are wrong , impatient because of a stagnation we ca n't afford . " a good start the criticism is all the more striking given the fact that business leaders , thumann included , were well-disposed toward merkel and her economic platform during her government 's first few months . " they had a good start with their economic policy if you consider that they embarked on a budget consolidation process , and decided to raise the retirement age from 65 to 67 , which was an unpopular but necessary decision , " said barbara böttcher , economist with deutsche bank 's think tank , db research . " now , they seem to have run into deeper waters with the reform of -lrb- unemployment benefit legislation -rrb- hartz iv , health care sector reforms , and corporate tax reform . " böttcher said that merkel would likely be making swifter progress had her christian democrats been able to form a coalition with the free-market liberal democrats -lrb- fdp -rrb- , as planned .
instead , she has to work on maintaining harmony with the more traditionally leftist wing of the social democratic party , which gained in influence following the departure of gerhard schröder , a reform-minded moderate . " the constraints now are much stronger than anticipated , " böttcher said . recipe for success germany 's economy is not performing too badly at the moment .
in fact , much of the news is downright positive .
both export and domestic industry are doing well , consumer spending is up , and investment in germany is improving .
the bdi reports that the german economy will likely grow by 2 percent this year , and thumann added that it would be possible to repeat this in 2007 - if economic reforms are put in place . thumann 's list of necessary reforms includes loosening job protection rules , cutting corporate taxes , and simplifying the country 's federal structure which has hampered reforms in the past . thumann is not alone .
axel weber , president of germany 's central bank , has called on the government to put new concepts for pension reform on the table as quickly as possible .
and over the weekend , german president horst köhler warned the government of the need to combat stubborn mass unemployment with decisive reforms , and to simplify the german tax system . " i often ask myself why german politicians are so timid , " thumann said , adding that improved business confidence levels plus the majority held by merkel 's coalition have created the ideal conditions to introduce ambitious reforms . keeping up with the joneses bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german consumers will have to get used to higher vat starting in 2007 " ambitious " may be one way of describing the government 's recent decision to increase value-added tax by 3 percentage points to 19 percent starting in 2007 .
but it was a move that was widely panned by economic experts who predict it will dampen consumer spending just as it is starting to recover . economists are hoping for better results from the government 's plans to revamp the country 's corporate tax regulations .
finance minister peer steinbrück has announced " the outline of a plan to lower corporate dues to below 30 percent " by 2008 .
currently , companies pay 36.8 percent on profit compared with 15 percent in ireland and 17.4 percent in poland . but industry leaders and economists say the government needs to aim even lower if it wants to stem the export of jobs abroad . " we have to make sure we gain competitive advantage when it comes to corporate taxes , " böttcher said .
" twenty-five percent should be the orientation mark .
if we leave that until the end of the decade , it will be too late . " deanne corbett send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de experts hope merkel gets germany working angela merkel will have to soften some of her radical economic reforms if the so-called grand coalition of left and right is to get germany back to work , analysts said on monday .
-lrb- oct .
11 , 2005 -rrb- oecd urges germany to press on with reforms the oecd has urged germany to press ahead with reforms to help boost growth and spur consumer demand , traditionally the achilles ' heel of recovery in the euro zone 's biggest economy .
-lrb- may 31 , 2006 -rrb- vat increase puts germany closer to eu average the 3 percent value-added tax increase that was part of chancellor angela merkel 's election campaign did n't come as a surprise to anyone in germany , but that does n't mean everyone is willing to accept it .
-lrb- may 20 , 2006 -rrb- feedback to what do you attribute german resistance to economic reform ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

but it was a move that was widely panned by economic experts who predict it will dampen consumer spending just as it is starting to recover . economists are hoping for better results from the government 's plans to revamp the country 's corporate tax regulations .
finance minister peer steinbrück has announced " the outline of a plan to lower corporate dues to below 30 percent " by 2008 .
currently , companies pay 36.8 percent on profit compared with 15 percent in ireland and 17.4 percent in poland . but industry leaders and economists say the government needs to aim even lower if it wants to stem the export of jobs abroad . " we have to make sure we gain competitive advantage when it comes to corporate taxes , " böttcher said .
" twenty-five percent should be the orientation mark .
if we leave that until the end of the decade , it will be too late . " deanne corbett send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de experts hope merkel gets germany working angela merkel will have to soften some of her radical economic reforms if the so-called grand coalition of left and right is to get germany back to work , analysts said on monday .
-lrb- oct .
11 , 2005 -rrb- oecd urges germany to press on with reforms the oecd has urged germany to press ahead with reforms to help boost growth and spur consumer demand , traditionally the achilles ' heel of recovery in the euro zone 's biggest economy .
-lrb- may 31 , 2006 -rrb- vat increase puts germany closer to eu average the 3 percent value-added tax increase that was part of chancellor angela merkel 's election campaign did n't come as a surprise to anyone in germany , but that does n't mean everyone is willing to accept it .
-lrb- may 20 , 2006 -rrb- 9800 radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .

german industry irked by slow pace of reforms -pipe- business -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 21.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 01.11.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de business -pipe- 21.06.2006 german industry irked by slow pace of reforms großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : reforms in germany are moving at a turtle 's pace , experts complain while most of the country is swept up in world cup fever , that 's not the case for german business leaders .
they 've been eyeing up chancellor merkel 's progress on economic reforms and wonder what she 's waiting for . angela merkel may be enjoying the highest popularity ratings of any post-war german chancellor , but she is fast losing favor among the country 's business leaders and economic experts . at a meeting of industry representatives in berlin on tuesday , the president of the bdi industry federation , jürgen thumann , renewed his stinging criticism of merkel 's reform politics and demanded that her grand coalition of conservatives and social democrats pick up the pace . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : merkel is losing favor with the bdi industry association the difficulty she would have in leading this unwieldy coalition of former political opponents was well noted when merkel took office .
but according to thumann , this difficulty is no excuse for political hemming and hawing over much-needed reforms . " we , the bdi and our members are starting to get rather impatient , " he told reporters in berlin on monday .
" impatient because the political debate in germany has hardly yielded any results yet , impatient because of many political decisions we think are wrong , impatient because of a stagnation we ca n't afford . " a good start the criticism is all the more striking given the fact that business leaders , thumann included , were well-disposed toward merkel and her economic platform during her government 's first few months . " they had a good start with their economic policy if you consider that they embarked on a budget consolidation process , and decided to raise the retirement age from 65 to 67 , which was an unpopular but necessary decision , " said barbara böttcher , economist with deutsche bank 's think tank , db research . " now , they seem to have run into deeper waters with the reform of -lrb- unemployment benefit legislation -rrb- hartz iv , health care sector reforms , and corporate tax reform . " böttcher said that merkel would likely be making swifter progress had her christian democrats been able to form a coalition with the free-market liberal democrats -lrb- fdp -rrb- , as planned .
instead , she has to work on maintaining harmony with the more traditionally leftist wing of the social democratic party , which gained in influence following the departure of gerhard schröder , a reform-minded moderate . " the constraints now are much stronger than anticipated , " böttcher said . recipe for success germany 's economy is not performing too badly at the moment .
in fact , much of the news is downright positive .
both export and domestic industry are doing well , consumer spending is up , and investment in germany is improving .
the bdi reports that the german economy will likely grow by 2 percent this year , and thumann added that it would be possible to repeat this in 2007 - if economic reforms are put in place . thumann 's list of necessary reforms includes loosening job protection rules , cutting corporate taxes , and simplifying the country 's federal structure which has hampered reforms in the past . thumann is not alone .
axel weber , president of germany 's central bank , has called on the government to put new concepts for pension reform on the table as quickly as possible .
and over the weekend , german president horst köhler warned the government of the need to combat stubborn mass unemployment with decisive reforms , and to simplify the german tax system . " i often ask myself why german politicians are so timid , " thumann said , adding that improved business confidence levels plus the majority held by merkel 's coalition have created the ideal conditions to introduce ambitious reforms . keeping up with the joneses bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german consumers will have to get used to higher vat starting in 2007 " ambitious " may be one way of describing the government 's recent decision to increase value-added tax by 3 percentage points to 19 percent starting in 2007 .
but it was a move that was widely panned by economic experts who predict it will dampen consumer spending just as it is starting to recover . economists are hoping for better results from the government 's plans to revamp the country 's corporate tax regulations .
finance minister peer steinbrück has announced " the outline of a plan to lower corporate dues to below 30 percent " by 2008 .
currently , companies pay 36.8 percent on profit compared with 15 percent in ireland and 17.4 percent in poland . but industry leaders and economists say the government needs to aim even lower if it wants to stem the export of jobs abroad . " we have to make sure we gain competitive advantage when it comes to corporate taxes , " böttcher said .
" twenty-five percent should be the orientation mark .
if we leave that until the end of the decade , it will be too late . " deanne corbett send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de experts hope merkel gets germany working angela merkel will have to soften some of her radical economic reforms if the so-called grand coalition of left and right is to get germany back to work , analysts said on monday .
-lrb- oct .
11 , 2005 -rrb- oecd urges germany to press on with reforms the oecd has urged germany to press ahead with reforms to help boost growth and spur consumer demand , traditionally the achilles ' heel of recovery in the euro zone 's biggest economy .
-lrb- may 31 , 2006 -rrb- vat increase puts germany closer to eu average the 3 percent value-added tax increase that was part of chancellor angela merkel 's election campaign did n't come as a surprise to anyone in germany , but that does n't mean everyone is willing to accept it .
-lrb- may 20 , 2006 -rrb- feedback to what do you attribute german resistance to economic reform ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

bonn 's blue samurai -pipe- features -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 21.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 01.11.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de features -pipe- 21.06.2006 bonn 's blue samurai großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : enthusiasm for their team - and for exploring germany japan 's national soccer team - and many of their countrymen and women - is staying in bonn this month during the world cup .
dw-world.de talked to both germany 's guests from the land of the rising sun and their hosts . a stroll through the streets of bonn will reveal that many japanese visitors have traveled half way around the world to support their national soccer stars as they face the world 's very best this month in the world cup .
they have chosen to stay in the former german capital for part or all of the month of june because the japanese team also has set up its headquarters here . while all of germany was busy preparing for scores of international guests , bonn focused especially on preparation for the japanese guests to come . g-jamps the team 's official media and fan headquarters - dubbed g-jamps -lrb- germany japan national team media partners supporters -rrb- - is not located in a hotel , stadium or office building , but in a museum . " we chose -lrb- the rheinisches landesmuseum -rrb- as our media and fan center because many of the guests from japan who are coming to bonn during the world cup also want to take a bit of culture back with them , " said masato watanabe , a representative of the japanese football association . g-jamps serves as a central meeting point not only for japanese visitors and journalists but also for anybody interested in the japanese team .
but soccer is just the beginning .
courses , performances and presentations are being offered throughout the world cup in cooperation with the german-japanese society - everything from flower arranging and kimonos to martial arts , go -lrb- a japanese board game -rrb- and origami is on the program . the museum 's restaurant features both japanese and local cuisine and , in the spirit of intercultural understanding , sushi is only on offer when the german team plays . sausage a n d beer bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : fans were waiting with pens and hopeful smiles when the team left their hotel to go to practice a japanese beer-maker is an official sponsor of the country 's team and its presence ca n't be overlooked at g-jamps .
but visitors from japan are eager to take advantage of the opportunity to get to know elements of german culture while they are in the country .
it is not surprising that beer and sausage are among the musts . " most of the japanese guests speak good english and those who do n't bring pictures with them of german dishes they would like to try , " said paul hofmann , a server at haus daufenbach .
through connections with the united nations , located in bonn , the combined restaurant and hotel also has numerous guests from other un nations , including yemen , ecuador , and ethiopia . michael thomas from zum gequetschen -lrb- which could be roughly translated as " at the squeezed " -rrb- , a popular restaurant in the city center featuring traditional german cuisine , said that around 50 percent of international guests this month are from japan . " the japanese customers drink less and meals are more communal , " he said .
" they 'll order one dish and four plates and share it . " home comfort bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : both sushi and sausage are availabe here at the blue samurai 's media and fan headquarters but heavy german dishes on a daily basis get to be too much after a while .
according to a server at a bonn sushi bar , some of the japanese visitors also search out more familiar tastes in between the sauerkraut and bratwurst . " the japanese noodle house around the corner has many japanese guests , " she said .
" they prefer warm dishes and sushi is more of a snack .
they come here first to eat sushi and then they go over to the noodle house for miso soup , tempura and other warm things . " big stadium or big scree n bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the rising sun is visible all day long in bonn to welcome the team and their fans well nourished , rested and ready to go , blue samurai fans have several options when it comes to watching their team in action .
the best bet is to visit the stadium in bonn , where the team trains .
times are made public and entry is free - quite a deal , considering the hundreds of euros people pay to see the same team in a live game .
the only disadvantage , of course , is the absence of an opponent . those who want to see the games but do n't have tickets can still enjoy the stadium atmosphere by going to the big screen set up on one of bonn 's two large , open market squares .
there the cheapest seat goes for 11 euros -lrb- 13.50 dollars -rrb- , which makes the slightly smaller screen at the pub around the corner look a bit more appealing . megunu and musaku , two soccer fans from japan , were on their way to view the blue samurai during a training session at bonn 's stadium .
they had met as tourists in barcelona and decided to continue on together to germany for the world cup .
when asked about the blue samurai 's performance , musaku did n't beat around the bush . " the players are very good , but the coach is bad , " he said . o n e poi n t for japa n japan 's national coach , zico , is a soccer legend from brazil . " in my opinion it 's better to face brazil in this round rather than later in the k.o. round , " zico was quoted as saying in die zeit .
" better now and then again the finals .
whoever wants to achieve something at the world cup has to be prepared for everything . " after losing to australia last week 3-1 and tying with croatia 0-0 on sunday , the blue samurai will come up against zico 's native brazil on thursday , june 22 at 7 p.m.
utc . kate bowen send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de a tale of two cities - tokyo and berlin an art exhibition showcases more than a century of german-japanese artistic exchange opened last week at berlin 's national gallery .
it features everything from dada and mavo to giant polka dots and sleeping containers .
-lrb- june 15 , 2006 -rrb- japan survive croatia challenge but chances of progress slim japan and croatia battled to a goalless draw in nurenberg on sunday which left both nations with a slim chance of reaching the second round of the world cup .
-lrb- june 18 , 2006 -rrb- japan coach zico drafts in ogasawara for crucial croatia clash japan coach zico is looking to kashima antlers skipper mitsuo ogasawara to bolster his flagging attack in the make-or-break world cup match against croatia on sunday .
-lrb- june 18 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic world cup reporter : turning japanese feedback we want to hear from you !
send us an e-mail if you would like to respond to any article .
please include your name and country .
